meanings.definition: A person who hesitates or refuses to proceed with an action.
meanings.sent1: The balker stood at the edge of the pool, afraid to jump in.
meanings.sent2: The team couldn't make a decision because of the balker's indecision.
meanings.sent3: The balker at the buffet table couldn't choose between cake and pie.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure turned her into a balker on the stage of life.
meanings.sent5: The balker's hesitation cost them the opportunity of a lifetime.

meanings.definition: An obstacle or hindrance that prevents progress.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was a balker on the hiking trail.
meanings.sent2: The lack of funding proved to be a significant balker for the project.
meanings.sent3: The heavy traffic was a balker to their plans of reaching the beach early.
meanings.sent4: Miscommunication acted as a balker in their attempts to collaborate effectively.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds were a looming balker to their outdoor picnic.

meanings.definition: To hesitate or refuse to proceed with an action.
meanings.sent1: She tends to balker when asked to speak in front of a crowd.
meanings.sent2: The child began to balker when it was time to take the medicine.
meanings.sent3: He would always balker when it came to making important decisions.
meanings.sent4: The horse started to balker as they approached the stream.
meanings.sent5: Don't balker now; we're almost at the finish line!

meanings.definition: To stop short and refuse to go on.
meanings.sent1: The car's engine began to balker on the steep hill.
meanings.sent2: The old printer would often balker in the middle of printing a document.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to balker in the middle of his joke, leaving the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her courage started to balker as she reached the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The music player seemed to balker whenever it reached the last song on the playlist.
